Build I20021127

1) Create a path variable FOO that maps to "c:\temp"
2) Go into the new folder wizard, page two
3) Click the variables button
4) Select FOO from the list, hit OK.

An info box pops up saying "Path variable value cannot be relative".  This is
wrong, because it is NOT relative.  Then an NPE occurs. Stack trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.NullPointerException.<init>(NullPointerException.java:63)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardNewLinkPage.handleVariablesButtonPressed(WizardNewLinkPage.java:218)
	at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardNewLinkPage.access$7(WizardNewLinkPage.java:211)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardNewLinkPage$4.widgetSelected(WizardNewLinkPage.java:148)

Cannot reproduce.
I assume c:\temp exists and is a folder. Where does the "Path variable value 
cannot be relative" pop up? In the second page of the new folder wizard?

This was actually caused by an old variable that I had defined in a previous
integration build.  It can also be reproduced by adding a relative path in the
core resources preference store between sessions.  I asked Rafael to investigate
this because it's likely a core bug that we're letting these illegal path
variables through. Rafael, did you look into this?

Yes, now at the startup I'm removing any path variables that do not have a 
valid name/value. I'll submit a proper patch for it today.

I think we should move it to Core.
